channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Temporary lights in Gloucester Rd, 5th November
item.description:
Queues of traffic in all directions following the set up of temporary traffic lights and the closure down to a single lane on a critical artery into and out of Cheltenham. No indication of who set these up and not a soul to be seen. I noted the traffic queues when I went out on my bike at 9.15 and again upon my return at 11.00. No personnel on site at each of these times, and presumably between these times. What you do have is disruption and delay to hundreds of vehicles with any associated costs being incurred by each individual person or company caught up in the chaos - and with no financial impact felt by the organisation that set up the traffic lights nor the authority that allowed them to do it. Please investigate and let me know how this situation arose and how you propose to change processes to avoid any future reoccurence.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 396, Gloucester Road, Hatherley, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Information board identifying emergency contact company/number not displayed

item.title: Large indent between road surface and pavement, 5th November
item.description:
Outside drive of number 40 where the road meets the pavement/drive entrance. Since the road was resurfaced badly several years ago the mismatch between road surface and tarmac has been getting worse. It is now deep enough to cause wheel/ suspension damage and needs fixing !
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 38, Moorend Park Road, Leckhampton, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Tree is damaged problem, 5th November
item.description:
Tree outside number 9 has been cut down by the resident at number 7, they has disposed of the cuttings and they have doen this previously but it was never reported. he has also mentioned that he is going to remove the stump. he also cuts down the tree outside the customers property (Number 10) Stump is sticking up quite a bit as well.
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: More abandoned Highways flytipping, 5th November
item.description:
Yet another pile, reported numerous times, still ignored. Bypass between Gloucester Business Park & Zoons Court roundabout. In total there are now FIVE lots of Highways "litter" to be collected off this bypass. Tantamount to commercial flytipping.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Hucclecote, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Signs & Barriers left behind by Contractor

item.title: Freshly left abandoned signage etc, 5th November
item.description:
Yet another pile, this one freshly left! Broken cone bases, cones, sandbags, lights, signs right in edge of bypass at Zoons Court roundabout as you enter bypass towards the Biz Park. Bypass between Gloucester Business Park & Zoons Court roundabout. In total there are now FIVE lots of Highways "litter" to be collected off this bypass. Tantamount to commercial flytipping.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Hucclecote, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Signs & Barriers left behind by Contractor
